glsa.title: Ruby: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Ruby, the worst of which could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Ruby is an interpreted object-oriented programming language. The elaborate standard library includes an HTTP server (“WEBRick”) and a class for XML parsing (“REXML”).

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Ruby. Please review the referenced CVE identifiers for details.

impact.p: A remote attacker could execute arbitrary code, cause a Denial of Service condition, or obtain sensitive information.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Ruby users should upgrade to the latest version:
